With the ending of dollar books and book packs that contain the SAME book, I am no longer able to rely on Scholastic to help build my classroom library and my student‚Äôs libraries. Ordering is pretty simple, however, I'm rather confused about when I have earned $ to spend as a teacher when students place orders.  It seems that I'm always asked to add my own credit/debit card.  Is there something I'm missing?  Do I NEED to add my own card but then it's not charged when I "submit" the order?  Any help would be appreciated!
Additional Comments: See prior comments regarding $ for my teacher order. Thank you!

What could we improve: Honestly I am just heart broken to know that you took away services to teachers that help us out. I like to encourage building libraries at home for my students. I am a teacher... teaching at a poverty level school... so we do not have funds available to us either. I try the scholastic campaigns but no on will donate bc I only know people who are struggling as well. I use to buy a book a month for my students, so the $1 books, the book of the week, and the value packs that make a classroom set 10 for $10 made it affordable. Now you no longer offer these deals. The book of the month for $2 I guess would be the next thing I could go for but there is not options to ensure a good book for my grade level. So does this mean I need to start looking else where for the books I buy monthly for my students? I really hate that Scholastic is closing these chances to help teachers try and give the magic of reading to their students.
Additional Comments: BRING BACK Book of the week or the 10 for $10 packs.

Additional Comments: I would expect the shipment to be quick, considering the price of shipping.  So no kudos there.  We love Scholastic and have been using you for book fairs for years.  The Scholastic Dollars Catalog needs much improvement.  Thank you for letting us provide feedback.

What could we improve: I feel a little blind sided by scholastic. This summer scholastic promoted campaigns to raise money- I raised enough for my students to each get ten $2 books this school year. It was beyond frustrating when scholastic opened for the school year to see that there is only one two dollar book offered. In the future I will not do campaigns. It was misleading and I am disapointed.
